titleStmt.title: SII 13.167: original edition by G.V. Srinivasa Rao
No. 167. (A.R. No. 127 of 1919.) OLAGĀPURAM, TINDIVANAM TALUK, SOUTH ARCOT DISTRICT. ON THE SOUTH WALL OF THE CENTRAL SHRINE IN THE RUINED ŚIVA TEMPLE.

summary.p: The inscription is partly built in. It records a sale of land by the nagarattār (merchant guild) of Ulagamādēvipuram in Ōymā-nāḍu to Gaṅgaṉ Ambalavaṉ Gaṇḍarādi[tta]śōḻa-Viḻuppaṟaiyaṉ of Kuvaḷālam (Kolar) in Gaṅgarusāyira province, who endowed it for a flower-garden for the temple. This donor is evidently identical with Ambalavaṉ Gaṇḍarādittaṉār who is referred to in No. 54 above of the 3rd year of Rājakēsarivarman, as belonging to the Perundaram of the king and as having constructed the temple. Like No. 54 this may also be assigned to Rājarāja I. Among the boundaries of the land is mentioned a ridge or pathway called Kalikaṇṭaka-peruvarambu.

revisionDesc.change: Further conversion of digital encoding to DHARMA encoding scheme according to EGD (Encoding Guide for Diplomatic Editions)

div.p:
svasti śrī . kovirājakesaripanmaṟku yāṇṭu 7Āvatu Oymānāṭṭu
Ulakamātevipurattu nakarattoṅ kaṅkarasāyirattuk kuvaḷālamuṭaiya kaṅka ṉampalavaṉ kaṇṭarātitta
coḻa viḻupparaiyaṉukku nāṅkaḷ viṟṟukkuṭutta nilattiṉ kiḻpāṟkellai yeṅkaṇ mañcikkamāṉa kaṇṭarātitta ni
latti naṭuve poṉ kaṇṭarātittapperuvarampiṟku meṟkkut teṉpāṟkellai veṇkāṭṭup peruvarampiṟku vaṭakkum melpāṟke
llai kalikaṇṭakapperuvarampiṟkuk kiḻakkum vaṭapāṟkellai yerikiḻiruko ṉikkit teṟku min nāṉkellaiyilu
ttu pala nivan=taṅkaḷukkuṅ koṇṭa poṉ kaḻañcuṅ
vāḷaḷ kuṭṭeṟṟu Uḷḷiṭṭa tiruvuṇṇāḻikai sa
ṟpu tirunan=tavāṉappuṟamāka nilaṅ kāṇiyu
rupatiṉkāṇi kolāl nālāyirattaiññūṟṟeṇpattu muṉṟe ḻumāvaraikkuḻi vilaiyaṟak koṇṭi �
m palava kaṇṭarātittaṉukku nakaratto miṉṉila nāṉuṭaiyavaṇṇame yulakamātevipurattu śrī kayi
lavaṉ kaṇṭarātittaṉe Itu panmāheśvara rakṣai .
Digital edition of SII 13.167 by converted to DHARMA conventions by Emmanuel Francis.
